Formula: x:The age of the father; y:The sum of the ages of two children; x=3y; x+5=2(y+5)
problem: Father's age is three times the sum of the ages of his two children. After 5 years his age will be twice the sum of age of two children. Find the age of father.

Body: 5 years hence the age of a father shall be three times the age of his son while 5 years earlier the age of father was 7 times the age of his son.
Question: Find the present ages.
